rComments: He's pretty clear, the only real issue is that he's in charge of how the music major is run (at least for these lower-div classes) and what he doesn't understand is that people come into the major with varying levels of skill, but are graded the same way. It's really difficult for those who haven't had as much experience to catch up.

Super easy class. No need for textbook, just go to class. Professor plays awesome pieces in class. No tricks on midterms or finals, straightforward in similarity with questions he ask in class before any tests.

This class was great! I enjoyed all the beautiful music. Professor Leikin plays the piano wonderfully. This class will definitely help your gpa! Also his stories about each composer are very insightful. In total, take the class you won't regret it!
The easiest class ever!!! Barely had to study for the midterms, you can sleep through the lecture and still pass! do yourself a favor and take it!...Remember to study for the final tho :)
He was an amazing teacher. Pretty much the whole class gave him a standing ovation at the end of it. He is amazing at the piano and extremely passionate at what he teaches. Take this class if you can

take this if you want a very easy GE! you dont need to put much effort into this class until 2-3 days before the midterms/final. the key to do well in this class is to study the lecture notes and listen to the music.. go to his/or ta's review section and they'll tell you everything that will be on the final!

He is GREAT!! and talented! this professor knows exactly what he is talking about. He doesn't take role but my advice is to be present at the lectures to get all the notes. Listening is required to do good on the midterms and final.

I took this class mostly because it was the most interesting one I could take, and because I really wanted to get a better understanding of music, but I was pleasantly surprised to find the class was made very interesting and helpful by Anatole. He's a great professor and a really cool guy. My only regret is that I didn't go to his office hours.

He is an AMAZING piano player and ofter plays in class. He does have a thick accent which sometimes makes it hard to because you really have to concentrate to get what he is saying. Over all he is a decent professor. The tests are all listening based so if you are not particular familiar with music this class could be challenging for you.

Very passionate, minimal textbook use, overall a very easy A, provided you actually pay attention during lectures and listen to the music. Yes, you have to actually go to class. A background in music is strongly recommended!
learned to appreciate classical music in a whole new way. he explains how Beethoven is a comedian with his music. and he shreds on piano

This class is an easy and fun GE! It's also great for those who have no background in classical music, it's a great introduction. The class is like a music appreciation class you need to know terms and be able to recognize and identify songs. Just attend review sections and listen to the songs over and over and know the terms and you'll be fine!

Best class/prof at ucsc. This is the easiest class you will ever take at ucsc. TAKE it you will be doing urself and ur gpa a huge favor. Leikin is a great pianist and you will enjoy listening to him play. Attend his class everyday or have somebody record the lecture for you. His midterms are mostly from his lecture and his reviews he does in class

Prof. Leikin is an AMAZING professor. I have never had so much fun in a class. Yes, his midterms and finals are listening, and do require music and term memorization, but if you love music, studying for this class is not difficult. I did very well in this class and had no problems whatsoever. Just study, and you will be fine!

He is interested in the subject. He is willing to answer questions and tries to be very helpful. However, he has an accent that can sometimes be hard to understand and his tests are all listening based which for a lot of students including me was hard. You basically have to memorize things about specific songs and know the song just from hearing it

Anatole is GOD. A real genius on the piano and with his theory, anatole can make every student understand every lesson like its as easy as the a-b-c's. I went into the music major worried that I'd get burned out, but Anatole's brilliance and passion inspired me and definately helped shape the ultradedicated musician I am now. Amazing man

I wish I could have anatole for every class!  He is THE most helpful teacher I have ever had BY FAR.  He will come to school to help you on the weekends or the nights before tests. He is very dedicated to his student.  Best of all is his GREAT personality. He is the funniest guy. I want a recording of all the funny things he says!

Anatole is the best teacher I have ever had.  He is so funny!! He really makes himself available whenever you need help and he's really helpful during office hours.  He makes class fun. He's not as hard as everyone thinks he is. Get to know him if you have him- if you don't, you're missing out.

anatole is my favorite professor ever!! you gotta respect him because he is SOO talented, and really knows what he's talking about. makes the funniest jokes on accident. a very classy guy and charming~ very willing to help whenever. he makes me want to go to class.

"We are not in g minor anymore...we are not in Kansas anymore."  You have to love this wise, funny, amazing Russian...Russian 6/4 chord and all.  I am rather envious of those that had Anatole for music 30, because that would mean a whole year of Anatolee as opposed to one quarter.  He is thoroughly knowledgeable, talented, and totally hilarious.  Very good at saying something completely harsh to a student and making that same student laugh from a joke usually following his sharp comment.  Hit, but
Man, Anatole was hard but definitely worth my time.  He once returned a homework assignment saying "NO FOR 6/4 CHORDS!!!  I CAN'T TAKE IT ANYMORE!!!" and I pinned it up in my room.
Anatole Leikin is an engaging, motivational and humerous teacher as well as a brilliant pianist and musicologist.

Anatole has perfect pitch and is therefore not very understanding when interval training is difficult for students.  I have never felt so much like I was truly incapable of something as when I took his class.
His lectures are kinda boring. I readings were rather interesting. I liked it when he'd play the piano. Just make sure to do the readings and be in class when he reviews for the midterms and finals.

Anatole was awsome. He's a very knowledgable and amazing musician and professor. I loved his sense of humor. His lectures were sometimes unorganized and which made it hard to take notes, but the book will do. It's just fun to go to class and watch him play and talk so passionately about music.

Read the book, go to lecture, and study for the tests. It was cool when he did presentations during class (nearly every day). He was also extremely generous with grdaing, dropping two midterms if you did better on the final.

He is EXTREMELY knowledgeable about what he teaches. He is rather unclear at times because of his accent but it's usually not a problem. Obviously enjoys talking about music. If you're a music major you will eventually learn to love this man. His classes are easy but interesting, so take them.

He's not very clear sometimes, but his class has been very interesting. He's very knowlegible. When he wants to demonstrate something he will sit at the piano (or harpsichord or fortepiano) and play it. He has a sense of humor too.

I came into the class really excited, but lectures quickly changed that.  I thought they were unclear and lacked direction.  You don't need to go to lecture, just go to the review sessions right before the midterms and you will pass.  It was cool when he played piano or had the TA's play.

had him for intro to western music and he's one of the best teachers i've come across, definitely made a music class a great experience. He always plays piano in class as if it were concerts everyday, very talented man and is very funny

Anatole, did you write that last comment about yourself!?   Anatole is amazing and he is funny.  he has a good accent.  He teaches using metaphors about spaghetti when referring to the fingers on the keys.  I love him like a father or grandfather.   He's cool like the santa cruz sea breeze.

Anatole is unbelievably knowledgeable and very supportive of his students.  He is committed to finding effective ways for students to learn.  He is the only theory teacher I've ever had that actually provided a method for learning the material, rather than just teaching by rote. take his class!
